title: Leaverbuster busting chops
body: I understand the Leaverbuster system for afk and bots and all but the last 5 bans i had for 20 minutes before each game it keeps disconnecting me as soon as the 20 minutes is up so therefor i facepalm keyboard then continue to que again and same thing happens OVER AND OVER, i am connected to the internet and everything else then when i quit and come back and attempt to do so again you then tell me because i have not accepted my last few ques i am now on a ban ontop of my already bans, then i try that then it tells me im banned from joining ques period until that ban is up to go to my next ban only then to continue to my main ban of 20 minutes.................................. this is not the first time, yes i know what you're going to say " well stop getting bans and you wont  have a problem." trust me i know this, but when i do get bans I take my punishment and get them gone then continue having fun, but this has happened multiple times and you cant talk to anyone directly from riot or anything hardly now all you get is forum boards for everyone else to roast  your ass about your questions and concerns, I JUST WANT TO PLAY THE GAME THAT MAKES YOU MONEY, THATS IT! so please if there is anyway to stop having this issue of being disconnected after waiting 20 minutes everytime to only come back to more bans on top of my already existing bans that would be awesome, i know most people are going to make fun of me and say im whining and crap but this is ridiculous. Thanks

replies.body:
I'm certainly not here to *roast your ass* and in fact, we're going to work closely together to resolve this. ^.^

From your description, it sounds like the root of the problem is that you're disconnecting from our servers for one reason or another. The biggest reason that this happens is due to certain network settings locally that conflict with League. Our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) is a great place to address this because it covers the most common solutions for these misconfigurations. 

Let me know if those changes were able to resolve your issue.
